body: This is the "server-side" part of the new friend-finding. Nodes store small amounts of data on request, and support searching for it. --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/2147)

comment_data.body: The last argument should be bool (`false`).
Same here (bool).
`previous` is of type `bool` and can't be subtracted from a `uint64_t`. Use `?:` to turn it back into an int.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,40 @@
+/* SPDX-License-Identifier: GPL-3.0-or-later
+ * Copyright © 2019-2021 The TokTok team.
+ */
+#include "timed_auth.h"
+
+#include <string.h>
+
+#include "ccompat.h"
+
+static void create_timed_auth_to_hash(const Mono_Time *mono_time, uint16_t timeout, bool previous, const uint8_t *data,
+                                      uint16_t length, uint8_t *to_hash)
+{
+    const uint64_t t = (mono_time_get(mono_time) / timeout) - previous;

comment_data.body: Parameter `previous` is of type `bool`, but passing `uint8_t` here. Use `!= 0` or `> 0` to turn `i` into a `bool`.
Prefer doxygen-style comments (they are parsed more strictly and benefit from decl/defn checks, ensuring decls have the same comment as defns).

comment_data.body: Maybe too late, but have you considered using msgpack for the new packets?

+    NET_PACKET_FORWARD_REQUEST      = 0x90,

comment_data.body:
* success if now - generation_time <= timeout
* failure if now - generation_time >= timeout * 2

What happens if it's in between?

comment_data.body: This reads as "packet is a single uint8_t that I'm setting here". `packet[0] = NET...` may be a bit clearer. I realise a lot of your code does `*packet = val`, but this particular one is followed by `packet[1]`, and packet isn't incremented, so it makes sense here.
Might be worth putting all of these in a struct and using an array of that struct.
Remove empty line.
These should have tests in crypto_core_test.cc.
Remove extra `* `.

This function seems to exist so you don't need to pass the DHT to the announce constructor. What was the reasoning here? It's certainly not less code, so are you trying to express some relationships or invariants through this extra code?

comment_data.body:
`chain_keys` is undocumented. Can you make it doxygen-style comments with `@param` and stuff? That way this becomes more obvious. It's important to document that `chain_keys` is `key size * chain_length` in size.

Also, this function needs to check its inputs. E.g. check that chain_length is actually `<= MAX_FORWARD_CHAIN_LENGTH` and data_length etc.

comment_data.body: This VLA can grow indefinitely given malicious inputs. I see `create_forward_chain_packet` does check its inputs, but `send_forward_request` doesn't.

comment_data.body: done
This looks like a `switch`. Also, it's probably worth extracting functions for each of the cases, as they are quite large.

Maybe remove this.

ISO/IEC 9899:1999 (E) 6.5.3.4p3:
> When applied to an operand that has type char, unsigned char, or signed char, (or a qualified version thereof) the result is 1.

Can you document the parameters? What kind of key is `key`? Where do you get one from?

What is `auth`? Most of the time, given a parameter like `public_key`, you can find a `PUBLIC_KEY_SIZE` somewhere nearby, but there's no `AUTH_SIZE` (there is a `HMAC_SIZE`, maybe this should be called `hmac`?). Better yet: put `uint8_t hmac[CRYPTO_HMAC_SIZE]`, or if you want you can keep the name `auth` with explicit size.

commit.message:
feat: add forwarding and announce request handling

This is the "server-side" part of the new friend finding system,
allowing DHT nodes to store small amounts of data and permit searching
for it. A forwarding (proxying) mechanism allows this to be used by TCP
clients, and deals with non-transitivity in the network.

parent 97acb39c1fd4ec05421729295e969d762b63cd01

committer zugz (tox) <mbays+tox@sdf.org> 1648944008 +0000

feat: add forwarding and announce request handling

This is the "server-side" part of the new friend finding system,
allowing DHT nodes to store small amounts of data and permit searching
for it. A forwarding (proxying) mechanism allows this to be used by TCP
clients, and deals with non-transitivity in the network.

labels.description: New feature for the user, not a new feature for build script

title: feat: Store announcements
